doc.field: - Moody's Investors Service said it has confirmed its ratings on about 4.4 billion dlrs of outstanding securities of Public Service Electric and Gas Co, a unit of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. The ratings include Aa3-rated first and refunding mortgage bonds, secured pollution control revenue bonds and Eurobonds. Although Public Service recently received a disappointing rate order from the New Jersey Board of Public Utilities, the agency believes the company's strong financial management should help maintain debt-protection measurements within current levels over the next few years.
